meanings.definition: The branch of geology that deals with the description and classification of rocks, especially by microscopic examination.
meanings.sent1: Studying petrography helps geologists understand different types of rocks.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use petrography to analyze the composition of rocks at a microscopic level.
meanings.sent3: The petrography lab was so small that only one person could fit inside at a time.
meanings.sent4: In the world of petrography, rocks reveal their secrets under the microscope's lens.
meanings.sent5: Petrography is like a detective story where rocks hold clues to Earth's history.

meanings.definition: The description and classification of rocks, especially by microscopic examination.
meanings.sent1: During the petrography workshop, students learned how to identify different rock types.
meanings.sent2: Petrography allows scientists to study rocks in great detail to understand their origins.
meanings.sent3: The petrography report was so detailed that it included every tiny rock feature.
meanings.sent4: Through petrography, rocks become characters in the Earth's geological narrative.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of petrography lies in uncovering the hidden stories within rocks.
